principles.name: Somatic Anchoring Early
principles.description: Ground in body awareness within first 3-5 sentences
principles.rule: Every script MUST begin with body awareness within the first 150 words
principles.why: The body is the foundation. You can't do deep work if someone's floating in their head.
prompt_directives: Begin script with body/breath awareness in first 100-150 words
Include at least one of: breath mention, physical sensation, weight, temperature, contact points
Anchor in present moment through physical sensations
Give permission to settle into the body

quality_gates.check: Body or breath referenced in first 100 words

examples: And as you settle into this moment, you might begin to notice the breath, moving in its own rhythm, the weight of your body supported...
Taking a moment to notice where your body makes contact with the surface beneath you, feeling the support that's always been there...
And you might become aware of the breath, flowing naturally, effortlessly, just as it has been all along...

principles.name: Metaphor Consistency
principles.description: One central metaphor per script, all imagery serves ONE landscape
principles.rule: One central metaphor per script. All imagery must be coherent within that metaphor world.
principles.why: A script is a journey through one landscape, not a tour of disconnected scenes.
prompt_directives: Select ONE primary metaphor that fits the presenting issue
All subsequent imagery must be coherent with this central metaphor
Do not introduce unrelated metaphorical landscapes
Related imagery within same metaphor world is allowed

quality_gates.instruction: Identify primary metaphor family (garden, water, journey, building, light, etc.)
Flag if multiple unrelated metaphor families detected (e.g., garden AND mountain)

metaphor_selection_rules.allow: Related imagery within same metaphor world

principles.name: Language Rhythm
principles.rule: Sentence structure and length reflect intended trance state
principles.why: The cadence teaches the nervous system.
prompt_directives: Opening (light trance): 8-12 word sentences, simple structure
Deepening (medium): 12-18 word sentences, compound flowing
Core work (deep): 18-25 word sentences, complex layered meandering
Emergence (return): Gradually shorten from 18→15→12→8 words

quality_gates.check: Not all sentences same length (variance required)

examples.opening: And you might notice the breath.
examples.deepening: And as you continue to relax, you might notice how the breath moves naturally, effortlessly.
examples.core: And in this deep space, as you allow yourself to simply be, to rest, to receive what your body already knows, what has always been true...
examples.emergence: Taking a gentle breath. Becoming aware. Returning refreshed.

principles.name: Emotional Safety
principles.description: Permission, not commands - lead with invitation
principles.rule: Lead with invitation. Commands only after safety established.
principles.why: The subconscious needs to feel safe to open.
prompt_directives: Establish safety through permissive language first
Use invitation words: might, perhaps, could, if it feels right, at your own pace
Commands only after permission framework established
Client must maintain agency throughout
safety_language_library: As much or as little as feels right...

quality_gates.check: Client has choice and agency throughout

principles.name: Specificity Without Prescription
principles.description: Concrete enough to create experience, vague enough to be personal
principles.rule: Must be vivid to land, but personal to fit.
principles.why: Scripts need to be concrete enough to create an experience, but flexible enough to be personally relevant.
prompt_directives: Name the category of experience
Offer 2-3 specific examples
Add 'or whatever X means to you' for flexibility
Trust the client's subconscious to fill in personal details

too_specific: You feel tingling in your left hand
You are at the beach in Hawaii
just_right: You might notice a sensation in your hands... warmth, or tingling, or perhaps just presence...
A color that represents peace for you...
Someone who loves you... real or imagined...
A place where you feel completely safe... familiar or imaginary...

formula: 3. Add 'or whatever X means to you'

quality_gates.check: Specific sensory details with flexibility phrases

principles.name: Recognition of Inherent Wholeness & Functional Improvement
principles.description: Remind wholeness AND weave tangible functional improvements throughout
principles.rule: Scripts remind wholeness while suggesting specific functional improvements. Not emotional affirmations, but tangible changes.
principles.why: The listener is whole AND their systems can improve. Functional suggestions create real-world transformation.
prompt_directives: Use language of remembering, not acquiring ('your body already knows')
SELECT 3-5 FUNCTIONAL IMPROVEMENTS MAXIMUM - choose from categories below
DISTRIBUTE these across the script: 1 in opening, 1-2 in middle, 1-2 near end
KEEP EACH STATEMENT TO 1-2 SENTENCES - then move on with the narrative
TIE TO METAPHOR when possible: 'Like the [metaphor], your nervous system remembers...'
NEVER DUMP AS A LIST - space them naturally throughout the script flow
Functional Improvement Categories (SELECT 3-5 TOTAL, NOT ALL):
- Physical Restoration: 'Your body healing and replenishing completely'
- Sleep Quality: 'Your sleep deepening night after night'
- Cognitive Enhancement: 'Memory becoming clearer, words flowing easily'
- Energy & Vitality: 'Your energy replenishing completely'
- Stress Response: 'Your nervous system learning deeper calm'
Distribution Pattern:
- Opening/Deepening (1): 'As you rest, your body begins its natural healing'
- Middle Work (1-2): 'Like [metaphor], your nervous system remembers calm'
- Integration/End (1-2): 'This calm continues, your sleep deepening each night'
Avoid emotional affirmations like 'you are loved' - focus on FUNCTIONAL improvements
For regular scripts: Scatter throughout + count 1-5 emergence
For sleep scripts: Continue these as client drifts, no counting, natural sleep transition

use_functional_improvements: Your body healing and replenishing completely
Your sleep deepening night after night
Words coming more easily, thoughts flowing smoothly
Your nervous system learning deeper calm
weaving_pattern: Opening (1 statement, 1-2 sentences): 'As you rest, your body begins its natural healing'
Middle (1-2 statements scattered): 'Like [metaphor], your nervous system remembers calm'
Near End (1-2 statements): 'This peaceful state becoming natural, your sleep deepening each night'
NEVER as a list or paragraph dump - each statement woven naturally into narrative flow
For sleep scripts: Continue scattered pattern as they drift, no formal ending

functional_categories.note: SELECT 3-5 IMPROVEMENTS TOTAL from these categories. These are EXAMPLES - use 1-2 from each category chosen, not entire lists.
physical_restoration: Your body healing and replenishing completely
sleep_quality: Your sleep becoming deeper night after night
cognitive_enhancement: Words coming more easily, thoughts flowing smoothly
stress_response: Your nervous system learning deeper calm
Stress releasing more easily from your body

quality_gates.check: Includes at least 2 functional improvement categories
Avoids emotional affirmations, focuses on functional changes
Functional suggestions distributed throughout script, not just at end
